main event: A civilian professor observed a very bright star-like object with a halo around it for about 5 minutes on 25 May 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared to be stationary and starlike in appearance,The observation was made at dusk under clear conditions,The observer used binoculars to get a clearer view,The object was described as a very bright blue star, similar to Venus,The observation lasted for approximately 5 minutes before the object faded out.
sighted object: very bright star-like object with a halo
witness description: Civilian, Registered Assistant Professor, Department of Physics, Middle Tennessee State College, very reliable.
